did.abstract: Business, financial, and personal correspondence of a North Carolina family, primarily reflecting the affairs of Allen and Richard C. Gentry. These papers include material concerning land dealings, tobacco planting, local politics and the Know-Nothing party (1857), and the Civil War. Among four soldiers' letters is a letter from Levi C. Gentry, written while he was a prisoner of war at Johnson's Island, Ohio.
